title: How many years ago was the 8th century BCE? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll let you figure it out. How many centuries are we away from the start of CE? Then add the number of centuries BCE. Since they count backward starting from where CE starts, that gives a good approximation. Since we are only 20 years in, you could just say 20 centuries and 20 years (hence this year being 2020) and the same sort of adjustment could be made on the other end if it wasn’t the century mark. Basically add the two dates together. Now maybe we won’t have someone asking how many years ago was 1653 BCE? Just add the two dates together unless you are only working on one side or the other of that starting point, then subtract the two dates. Like the age of the US: 2020 -1776 =244

There have been 2019 completed years since the birth of Christ. There was no Year Zero. The Last Year of the 8th century B.C. was 800 B.C. (backwards, right). So the answer is 799 + 2019 = 2818 years Edited - Thanks Bob 😀
